intro: Diphasiastrum alpinum var. ergakense, commonly known as the alpine spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its succulent, often blue-green leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils, thriving in cold, dry environments. It has a low, spreading growth habit and is often found in mountainous regions with limited soil coverage. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens as an ornamental plant.
